reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: After reading other reviews on this site I decided to stay here for three days while in Reyjavik, and I wasn't disapointed. My single room was clean and modern; small but not cramped. The room met the promised description with a good sized wardrobe (although not enough hangers for my liking) an LCD TV with a reasonable selection of English, Icelandic and Swedish TV channels, desk, and a clean confortable bed (although the pillow was too thin). It also had a minibar which came in handy for chilling drinks.
reviews.title: No Complaints Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also had no complaints with the bathroom, but like all of Reyjavik the hot water has a strong smell of sulphur which you never get used to! Room Service came everyday with clean towels and bedsheets.
reviews.title: Great location in the center of Reykjavik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a little disapointing: only two types of corrnflakes, a selection of (unchilled) ham and cheese, yoghurt and some bread and a toaster to make your own toast. I found it adequte, but if you're going to be doing something strenuous that day, you'll need to eat more than what was available here. The breakfast room turns into a restaurant after 12 so isn't really up to serving a self-service operation, and therefore it can turn into a bit of a scrum to get your food.
reviews.title: Convenient and cozzy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the newer part of the hotel. I took a wrong turn and ended up in the older part which didn't seem as nice as my part, so if you're thinking of coming here make sure you ask for the new annex.
reviews.title: Not Spectacular, but Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, there a plenty of worse hotels in Reyjavik and the better one's are ten times more expensive than the Fron. Just watch out for the Receptionists: politeness isn't one of their strong points.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Fron 4-7 September 2008 and would recommend to anybody looking for a centrally situated hotel, no complaints whatsoever.Booked all our trips at reception on a daily basis and recommend you visit the Blue Lagoon on the way to the airport if possible , never felt more relaxed heading home from a holiday !
reviews.title: Recommended !

likes.liked: — central location , clean , everything I expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Hotel Fron is located right in the middle of downtown Reykjavik. It is clean, modern and the staff was very friendly. There is a computer on every floor with free net access which is great! The staff booked my excursions as well as airport pick up and drop off. They took all the worries of getting around Reykjavik. They have maps for you take free of charge. Location was great! There is a free continental breakfast in the morning at the restaurant next door. The breakfast could have been a bit better but all in all, not bad. A bit pricey but competitive for Reykjavik.
reviews.title: Love the Fron!

likes.liked: — Clean, modern and close to everything. Very helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was booked to stay at Hotel Leifur Eiriksson, but when I arrived at midnight (4 flights and 40 hours after leaving home in outback Australia) I was told there was no room for me, and I was to be accommodated at Hotel Fron. No worries.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...bring sense of humour though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Fron is clean, secure and safe (good for solo female travellers). The only drama I had was that when I returned from a day of sight-seeing, all my belongings had been removed (except my toiletries in the bathroom cupboard). I went down to reception to find out why, and was told that the room was needed for other guests, and that they weren’t sure if I was staying or not. I suppose there must have been some breakdown in communication with the other hotel. It’s a bit dodgy though- having some stranger pack all your clothes up!
reviews.title: A nice hotel with a great location

likes.liked: — great central location, wonderful evening front desk staff (Hrefna), large rooms with kitchenette
likes.disliked: — VERY noisy weekend party scene right outside hotel, sulphur smell of water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that, the hotel is great. The photos are from the first room. The second room they gave me was smaller, but of the same quality.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay Right in the Middle of Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice hotel with perfeckt location. Nice, clean rooms and good service.
reviews.title: NIce....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel. A bit noisy early in the morning. Breakfast was OK, but had not much variety.
reviews.title: Nice hotel @ great location
Worth staying in, check-in in afternoon
reviews.text: Location of the hotel is great. A lot of nice restaurants nearby. Staff was very helpfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Book your excursions in Iceland. Due to the value of the Icelandic money it's cheaper to book there.
reviews.title: Christmas in Iceland - Great time but city very quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary: Good location that is within easy walking distance to the local sights and nightlife. The cold breakfast, included in lodging cost, was very good. It included milk, a variety of cereals, juices, fruits, breads, meats and cheeses. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We arrived early in the morning, so we had to wait to check-in (along with many other guests) until the afternoon for a vacant room. During the open period, we booked a trip to the Blue Lagoon (definitely worth while).
reviews.title: Great location, friendly and very helpfull staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in April. It seemed a good base for all things in Reykavik.
reviews.title: Go for a room in the rear complex

likes.disliked: — The noise from the Club next door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Its a small and smart hotel bang in the middle of the main shopping/bar/restaurant street so perferct as a base to explore.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Fron!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions are good, smart reception and a restaurant bolted on the side that serves good honest food. The room (suite) had a sofa. TV, small bathroom and overlooked the main street.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel in the middle of the main street
Hotel Excellent but do not book any trips with Reykjavik Excursions
reviews.text: After a tiring day doing the Blue Lagoon, walking and Whale Watching we retired to the hotel, that's when we realised we were sleeping next to an early hours of the morning club!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Now i like my drink and night life but when i want to sleep I need sleep and unfortunately the bass thumping through the wall went on all night AND morning, approx 6am it was still going when checked out on the last morning.
reviews.title: Reykjavik for the weekend...

likes.disliked: — Apt building itself a little too far from lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really well-located hotel right in the middle of the tourist-y area of Reykjavik. Close to what you'll want to visit. Other reports that noise might be a problem did not materialize--quite quiet, in fact. Breakfast very basic, but you're within easy walking distance of numerous other choices if you 're picky in this regard. Given the price this place was a steal: clean, plenty of room for two and a fold-out-sofa could have allowed for one more. The in-room safe was not bolted down----so a real thief could have walked away with the whole thing!!
reviews.title: Well-situated; helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Fron the first night of our 14 day trip and the last night. Great location, within walking distance to almost anything. We had great rooms both days. 3 bedroom suite the first stay and they arranged for an apartment on the back street for the last night. Both were fabulous, roomy and clean. The staff was very helpful and the breakfasts were very nice. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I visited hotel Fron in September 2009. It's a great hotel located right in the middle of the central downtown area. There are some great restaurants nearby - such as Indian Mango - a fantastic Indian just round the corner. It may be strange to have an Indian meal in Iceland, but with such great fish and a chef from Goa, it's an excellent combination.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location, excellent service, superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel rooms are spacious - I stayed in an Apartment which featured a sofa and kitchenette (not that I had time to use it...). Staff are very friendly and helpful, with lots of tips for sightseeing and excursion recommendations.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: The only downside is the initial surprise when the water smells of sulphur, but you soon get used to it!
reviews.title: Perfect location - on the main street with easy access to the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights at Hotel Fron and would definitely stay here again. The location is great, its on one of the main shopping streets, short walk to anywhere you would want to go. We stayed in room 314, it was a good size, comfy bed with a great shower. We never experienced any noise even on friday and saturday nights. The breakfast was very basic - bread, ham, cheese, cucumber, tomato, yoghurt, fruit, juice. It was included though to can't complain. The women behind the check in desk weren't exactly a friendly bunch, but there is one guy that was very friendly and helpful, so if you need help look out for him. I booked a tour with him and he gave me a discount for cash. Overall a very good experience.
reviews.title: Great location and value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I actually stayed here for a full month this past January. I was in a studio apartment and it was wonderful. The kitchenette was great and you can save a TON of money by cooking for yourself (Go to Bonus for groceries as it's the cheapest and theres one further down Laugavegur).
reviews.title: Great location, rooms, and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly. If you need an early check in just email and ask, as they will accommodate you if they can. I'm sure it's more difficult during high season, but it doesn't hurt to ask. They will book lots of different excursions for you and can be helpful with recommendations.
reviews.title: The combination of location and price cannot be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010
reviews.text: The breakfast is decent, and it's nice that it's included in the price and it's easy to take a banana or an apple for the road.
reviews.title: Great location, but could be much cleaner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, and it's probably the best price you'll find for a hotel that is that central. You can easily walk practically everywhere.
reviews.title: Nice small hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Fron for 5 nights in late November. Perfectly positioned on the main shopping street, we found that we were close to all the restaurants in Reykjavik and within a couple of metres of some great bars. Despite the close proximity, we didn't experience any problems with noise as the rooms are set slightly back from the main street. Breakfast is a "continental style" buffet with bread, meat and cheese but perfectly good to set you up for a days sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great value gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite spacious, with a fridge and a microwave though we didn't use it as there are plenty of great, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Shower was hot, though there is a certain sulphuric smell in the water that never leaves you whilst you are in Reykjavik!
reviews.title: Top notch value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we loved our stay at the Fron and were very glad that we chose this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, great price - what more could you want?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early in the morning and the staff welcomed us and fed us breakfast while our room was being readied. They did the same when we had an early departure flight and were being picked up before the dining room opened. We had booked a double but were upgraded to a very nice apartment at no extra charge. The hotel is within walking distance of everything -- restaurants, museums, etc. They can book any tours (Golden Circle, Northern Lights, airport bus, etc) all of which pick you up at the door. Internet access if you have a laptop.
reviews.title: Fabulous apartments.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Fron for 3 nights in November 09. We have been to Iceland many times and often let price sway where we stay in Reykjavik - this time Hotel Fron came up the cheapest and I am so pleased it did, we had a fabulous stay!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - really central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. My room was spacious and comfortable, for once the pictures on the hotel's website did not exaggerate. It had a balcony overlooking the main street - could have been noisy at the wrong time of year but midweek in winter it was perfect. Staff were patient and helpful with tours, and being a collection point for tours and the airport bus was much appreciated. A previous review commented on the sulphur smell in the hot water - that's because it is naturally heated geothermal water, which is piped to all buildings in Reykjavik - think "free spa treatment". If I had to suggest one improvement, I would have liked granola/muesli at breakfast, but I was very happy overall.
reviews.title: Everything I hoped for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: location, location, location... this hotel is right in the heart of the city, if you are looking to enjoy the main street atmosphere, restaraunts and night life. you can walk to every bar in less than 10 minutes. The staff is incredibly helpful, even in booking tours only a day in advance where they will just bill it to your room. We stayed in the 2 BR apartment room which was, as it says just like a 2 BR apartment with 2 twin beds in each room. It was plenty of space for 3 guys. There is a fridge, microwave cooking supplies, not that we used them. Only complaint i can come up with is that the water when showering had a sulpher like smell, but nothing where it prevented us from showering. the breakfast is ok, basic cereal, fruit, juices, breads, ham and salami and cheese. its quick and will hold you over till lunch if need be.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel- amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are simply looking for a place to sleep in the heart of the city and nothing too fancy hotel fron is a great option. Its also on the list of hotels where all the tours and fly bus to the airport will stop to pick you up.
reviews.title: Just Got Home!

likes.liked: — perfect location and the 8AM check in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from Iceland a couple of days ago and must say that this hotel was WONDERFUL! It is the PERFECT location and absolutely adorable. There is great breakfast buffet every morning with jams, fruit, cereal, cold cuts, yogurt, juices, teas and coffee. The front desk staff was very helpful in answering questions and booking tours. Some people have said that it can be noisy on the weekends but I found it to be fine. I was in the front room and fell sound asleep Saturday night. If you are worried...just bring ear plugs. The room was so clean and the water was so nice and hot...there is a grocery store right up the block so bring some food back to keep in the fridge and cook it later!!!
reviews.title: Good hotel in heart of city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Icelandair which made getting to and from the airport to the hotel easy. The hotel was in a wonderful location, right in the heart of the city. Great, we would stay there again.
reviews.title: Travel Agent at the Fron

likes.liked: — Free wireless internet, great location, nice morning staff, clean comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — no microwave in the kitchenette (and that's reaching for something)
